Comparing File Properties and Contents

Comparing files with the View Comparison utility is a special case, because the utility compares both file revision properties and their contents.

Remember that files that do not exist in both views cannot be compared.

To compare file properties and file contents:

  1. Open the view to be used as the source.

  2. Click View > Compare/Merge to select the view that will serve as the target.

  3. Click the Files tab on the lower pane of the View Comparison window.

  4. Select a pair of files.

  5. Do one of the following:

    • From the Item or context menu, select Compare Items.

    • Click the Compare Items   button on the toolbar.

  6. If the contents of the files in the source and target folders have the same MD5 checksum and the properties have the same values, the application displays a message stating that the files are identical.

    7. An icon that shows two pieces of blank paper, side-by-side, identifies identical files unless Use Merge Tracking for Merge Resolution has been selected. If this option is selected, the icon indicates that the properties and contents of the two files have not changed since the last recorded merge in either direction. Note that this option works as a toggle. Right-click on an item in the lower pane, and choose Display > Use merge tracking for merge resolution.

  7. If a pair of files has different properties in both folders, the Compare dialog displays the properties of the files side-by-side. Properties that differ appear in boldface type.

  8. If the files being compared are text files, click Compare Contents to use Visual Diff, which will display the contents of the tip revisions of the files. To exit Visual Diff and return to the File Compare dialog, click File > Exit.

  9. Use the <<Previous and Next>> buttons to move from one pair of files to the next.
